pageContext.claim: “Last year, a record 73 percent of the new jobs went to people who were out of the workforce and are now coming back to work for the first time in many years.”
pageContext.analysis: The 73 percent figure is correct, at least for the end of 2018. (The figure dipped a bit at the start of 2019.) But Trump's claim of a "record" is unconfirmed because this data was not collected by the Bureau of Labor Statistics prior to 1990. The number bounces around a lot and was close to 72 percent at one point in 2016.
